short: Saturated means drenched and full. When you fish out a slice of bread thatŌĆÖs fallen into your water glass and find itŌĆÖs disgustingly spongy and waterlogged, itŌĆÖs saturated.
long: Saturated originally meant ŌĆ£satisfied," but by the 1700s it could mean ŌĆ£soaked thoroughly.ŌĆØ In the twentieth century it developed marketing connotations, as in a saturated market ŌĆö one without room for competition. In chemistry, saturated refers to an organic compound, like a fatty acid, that contains the highest number of hydrogen atoms possible. When it comes to color, saturated means pure, or undiluted with white, grey, or black.
